revised_title: Two-Dimensional Steady Flow of a Viscous Fluid Behind a Solid Body
tldr: This article investigates the two-dimensional steady flow of a viscous fluid behind a solid body, focusing on the drag coefficient and the breakdown of laminar flow. The authors analyze the flow near a flat plate and compare their results with previous predictions. They find that the flow remains laminar at the Reynolds numbers tested and that the breakdown of laminar flow depends on the distance behind the plate.
